title: Amperes Law - thin wire inside cylindrical shell

content.description: A thin conducting wire is located along the central axis of a long conducting cylindrical shell of radius <math alttext="3.0 millimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>mm</mtext></math>, as shown in the figure. The central wire is carrying a current of <math alttext="1.0 amp" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></mstyle></math> toward the left, and the cylindrical shell is carrying a current of <math alttext="1.0 amp" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mn>1.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>A</mtext> </mstyle> </math> that is toward the right and uniformly distributed around the shell.
content.question: If the magnetic field has a magnitude <math alttext="B sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> at a distance of <math alttext="1.0 millimeter" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mn>1.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>mm</mtext> </mstyle> </math> from the central axis and a magnitude <math alttext="B sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> at distance of <math alttext="2.0 millimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>mm</mtext></mstyle></math> from the central axis, what is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction B sub 2 over B sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The ratio is undefined because <math alttext="B sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> are both zero.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
